title: Conductors - ranking E-field parallel plates slab

content.question: Two equal and oppositely charged plates create an electric field between them. A metal slab is inserted between them, as shown. When electrostatic equilibrium is reached, the electric field in regions <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math> respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitude of the electric field strength in regions <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub 1 equals E sub 2, which equals E sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than E sub 2, which is greater than E sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 1 equals E sub 3, which is greater than E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 2 is greater than E sub 1, which equals E sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub 1 equals E sub 3, which is greater than E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
